title: Static vs Dynamic Arrays
subject: Data Structures
theory: **Static Arrays** have fixed size (C arrays). **Dynamic Arrays** (ArrayList, Python List, Vector) resize automatically. When full, they create a new array double the size and copy elements over.

examples.code:
list.add(1); // O(1) mostly
// If full, resize triggers O(n) copy.
examples.explanation: Resizing happens rarely, so average cost is constant.

interview_questions.question: What is Amortized Complexity?
interview_questions.answer: The average time per operation over a sequence of operations. Dynamic array insertion is Amortized O(1).

summary: Dynamic arrays combine the speed of arrays with flexibility.
